content: WWW.TALKIMG.COMI present a new image hosting service, specially designed for BitcoinTalk and the entire community.After a few years of noticing how many images do not appear correctly in the forum or are very slow to load, not to mention the images that stop appearing after a few months or years, the TalkImg project was born. Purpose  ____________________Provide a hosting service dedicated to the BitcoinTalk forum that is useful and practical for everyone.It is intended that the images remain available in the forum, and have a fast loading. Features ____________________- All uploaded images can only be used in the forum (unless requested by a user; it can be done after an evaluation by joker_josue).- It is only allowed to upload images in formats accepted by the forum (JPG, JPEG, PNG, GIF).- Images must have a maximum size of 2.5MB.- Once uploaded, images cannot be deleted (unless you use the link generated at the time of upload, which is only accessible at that time).- NSFW images are not allowed.- No registration of user information is performed (only the IP is saved for spam control).- All EXIF information is deleted by the system when uploading.- Option in the code to embed the BBCode already with the actual height and width of the image (just choose "BBCode full fix HxW").- new Upload via link, applying the same rules for uploading files. (Temporarily Suspended) Long Term  __________________I have several years of experience with online galleries, and based on that experience I hope to keep this project online for as long as possible. Of course, we cannot predict the future, but what depends on me, this project will be maintained for many, many years. Server  _____________________The server dedicated to TalkImg is located in the Netherlands, consisting of NVMe SSD disks guaranteeing the best read/write speeds.It uses LiteSpeed Web Server software, which guarantees better performance. And with AMD EPYC processors, so all information is processed as quickly as possible. This service is already assured for the coming years, with the capacity to expand whenever necessary. Account ____________________This service is intended for exclusive use on BitcoinTalk, in this sense only forum users can have an account on TalkImg, for this reason the account creation option is not active for the general public. Users who want to have an account should contact joker_josue by PM to request it. The request will be evaluated and if approved the account will be created. Backups ___________________- The server automatically performs daily backups that will be kept for up to 30 days.- A ZIP is created weekly with all the new image uploads from the last week, which will be available for download for 15 days, here: talkimg.com/tempbackups/new ZIP Tool _________________Auxiliary tool, which allows you to ZIP images larger than 2.5MB. Compression is performed via PHP features, which can significantly reduce image quality. The image is automatically loaded, converted and sent to TalkImg, providing the link/BBCode to be used on the forum. This tool is still in BETA phase, and there may be errors.Access: Image Zip Tool - TalkImgnew Statistics ________________Total statistical data, since the project started (April 28, 2023):                                                                      Images: 176 591Disk Space: 52.7GBLast update: 04/04/2025Monthly statistics:[First 15 days][May'23][Jun'23][Jul'23][Aug'23][Sep'23][Oct'23][Nov'23][Dec'23][Jan'24][Feb'24][Mar'24][First Year][Apr'24][May'24][Jun'24][Jul'24][Ago'24][Sep'24][Oct'24][Nov'24][Dec'24][Jan'25][Feb'25][Mar'25] Donations & Ad  ______________The project should be supported by donations from the community and with advertisements similar to the forum signature campaigns.- Donations: Anyone wishing to support this project can make their bitcoin donations to the address: bc1qhwnncpdd8gfzqwjkk9n052wf7g9mvks3xaa7qa or Lightning Address: talkimg@wallets.fyoumoneypod.com- Ad: There will only be one ad on the homepage, similar to what we have today in user signatures. If a campaign manager wants to place an ad on TalkImg, please contact me. Coming Soon  ________________- Automatic file conversion system. (no scheduled date)- Possibility to define the size (height or width) of the image in BBCode. (no scheduled date) More Details _________________The site is managed by joker_josue, who will maintain it and provide full support to users.I am waiting for your opinion and suggestions; this service was made for the community and to better serve the community.It is intended that this project lasts as long as possible, whether it has a lot of acceptance or not. Therefore, all images that are uploaded are available forever. Links, Scripts & Add-ons  _______TalkImgTerms of ServicePrivacy Policynew TalkImg Service Statusnew Image Zip Tool - TalkImgSig Promote TalkImg###[Add-on] Add a button to upload an image directly from the forum - Created by TryNinja[Script] Imgur to TalkImg - automatically fix your broken images - Created by TryNinjaIf you develop a script or add-on that is public, let me know to update the list.new Events  ___________________TalkImg Awards - Image of the Year 2023 | sponsored by BC.Game / Icarus Local Boards _________________This topic is the only one that will support TalkImg users, and will always have official information about the project.But here is the list of topics translated to local boards:العربية (Arabic) Kavelj22Bahasa Indonesia (Indonesian) dansus021Bengali roksana.heeDeutsch (German) cyganEspañol (Spanish)  PorfiriiHrvatski (Croatian) ovcijisirNigeria (Naija)  ChilwellPakistan (Urdu) JunaidAziziPilipinas PeanutswarPolski cyganPortuguês (Portuguese) joker_josuePyccкий (Russian) zasad@Română (Romanian) GazetaBitcoinTürkçe (Turkish) mindrustIf you do a translation, let me know to update the list.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Nice JobThe only constraint members like me might have, is that some of us use third party screenshot and image uploading apps like Sharex. These apps upload images automatically to preset sites like Imgur, So I wonder if it would be possible to incorporate your site to such apps.How long do you plan to run this project?  You know it would be heartbreaking for the images hosted on the site that are linked to great threads in the forum to disappear after about 4-5 years when the site stops operating.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on April 28, 2023, 07:50:05 PMI present a new image hosting service, specially designed for Bitcointalk and the entire community.After a few years of noticing how many images do not appear correctly in the forum or are very slow to load, not to mention the images that stop appearing after a few months or years, the TalkImg project was born.Great work, but one issue I have with this hosting... what happens if in a few years this website hosting stops working, all images will be gone forever or there is some backup archiving solution in this case?Some of the worst things in forum for me is opening interesting old thread that is  full of error images that can't be loaded anymore. My suggestion is to add Delete button, if user decides to delete image himself for privacy or any other reasons.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: This is an outstanding accomplishment. I also see it as a service to the bitcointalk community since it is solely designed for us. I have had issues with using images because of the process and other issues that I have also encountered. It is also good to know that your new site promotes privacy which is very important to many members of the community. But my only reservation is the inability to delete uploaded pictures. Sometimes one might make a mistake in the selection of the picture and will only discover it when it has been uploaded. I think there should be freedom to delete pictures easily without any form of difficulty. I want to deeply appreciate you for your effort. I am hoping to be one of the first users of this package. Best regards.

comments.author: RickDeckard
comments.body: First of all, congratulations on this tool @joker_josue! It never hurts such a vast community to have its own image hosting, but I do have some questions/remarks (some already shared):What will happen to the image database if something happens to you? Would you consider give access to another (trusted) user in the future perhaps?Are you considering backups in the future? It would be a tremendous loss if anything happens to the pool of images later down the line;How are you planing dealing with the exponential hosting costs of such service? Depending on various factors (# users, # requests, image sizes) you'll probably be looking to a hefty price in the long term. Even if you do accept donations sadly I believe you won't be able to achieve a balance at the end of the month (thus paying out of your pocket which isn't feasible long term).;Shouldn't the website be accessible only to bitcointalk users? Like everything on the Internet, as soon as it gets more attention surely people will start to upload dozens of images (and probably some illegal as well). I know that this would be easy to circumvent - basically anyone would just create an account here just to get free image hosting - but perhaps this could also become a tool that would only be unlocked whenever a certain amount of merit & activity was reached?The way I see the verification happen is very manual - A user would input his/her username on your registration form and then perhaps you could have a username registered for the service here (like talkimgverification) that would demand a message to be sent from that username in order to verify that it was the owner who tried to registered in the platform.;How will you control NSFW/illegal pictures being submitted (because it is the Internet right?). By user reports? Won't you get in problems if there are many submissions/reports of this nature? (one more reason to restrict this tool to members of our community);I'm unaware of the user page, but having the possibility to create groups of pictures and a gallery view would be a nice addition in the future (no idea if it is an easy implementation to do...);Then again, great initiative! Looking forward to see what more experienced users have to say about this.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: First of all, thank you for everyone's support so far. Your feedback only makes me want to continue.  I'm going to answer some questions that were asked, I hope I can clarify:Quote from: rdluffy on April 28, 2023, 08:45:51 PMJust one question, as time goes by, won't the cost of maintaining all the images become too expensive?(even if your tool is only for the forum)In an initial phase, because I don't know how well accepted the service will be, I'm using cloud services, such as support for website hosting, which, as it still has little space, means it doesn't have a high cost. Let's see how things evolve, and if it goes well, I'll try new solutions. Perhaps, I can appeal for donations, but at this stage I did not think it was right to do so.Quote from: JeromeTash on April 28, 2023, 08:58:53 PMHow long do you plan to run this project?  You know it would be heartbreaking for the images hosted on the site that are linked to great threads in the forum to disappear after about 4-5 years when the site stops operating.No one can predict the future, but normally I don't like to let go of this type of project. So my plan is to keep it online as long as possible.Worst case scenario, disable new uploads, and keep existing images. But I hope to make sure that never happens. It all depends on community support.Quote from: dkbit98 on April 28, 2023, 09:04:07 PMGreat work, but one issue I have with this hosting... what happens if in a few years this website hosting stops working, all images will be gone forever or there is some backup archiving solution in this case?So that will be the next step will be to better structure the backup system so that everything can be kept online. In this initial phase I am using cloud services to ensure the hosting of the images, and based on acceptance by the community, I will readjust to keep everything safe. As I said, the evolution of the project will depend on how the community accepts it. I want to grow at the pace of community acceptance, because that's the only way I'll be able to keep everything working in a viable way.Quote from: dkbit98 on April 28, 2023, 09:04:07 PMMy suggestion is to add Delete button, if user decides to delete image himself for privacy or any other reasons.When uploading, a link is generated that serves to delete the photos. If you save the link, you can do this later. But, in a way, this is what you want to avoid, so as not to generate a post without images. And if the user wants to have greater control over their photos, they can request an account.Quote from: RickDeckard on April 28, 2023, 09:50:08 PMWhat will happen to the image database if something happens to you? Would you consider give access to another (trusted) user in the future perhaps?How are you planing dealing with the exponential hosting costs of such service? Depending on various factors (# users, # requests, image sizes) you'll probably be looking to a hefty price in the long term. Even if you do accept donations sadly I believe you won't be able to achieve a balance at the end of the month (thus paying out of your pocket which isn't feasible long term).;Shouldn't the website be accessible only to bitcointalk users? Like everything on the Internet, as soon as it gets more attention surely people will start to upload dozens of images (and probably some illegal as well). I know that this would be easy to circumvent - basically anyone would just create an account here just to get free image hosting - but perhaps this could also become a tool that would only be unlocked whenever a certain amount of merit & activity was reached?The way I see the verification happen is very manual - A user would input his/her username on your registration form and then perhaps you could have a username registered for the service here (like talkimgverification) that would demand a message to be sent from that username in order to verify that it was the owner who tried to registered in the platform.;How will you control NSFW/illegal pictures being submitted (because it is the Internet right?). By user reports? Won't you get in problems if there are many submissions/reports of this nature? (one more reason to restrict this tool to members of our community);I'm unaware of the user page, but having the possibility to create groups of pictures and a gallery view would be a nice addition in the future (no idea if it is an easy implementation to do...);Just highlighting the points I haven't answered yet:- If usage growth is large, I will certainly enlist the help of other users to help moderate and perhaps create a plan, in case something happens.- There will be costs, no doubt. But I'm already used to dealing with image hosting site. And that's why I can find servers with minimally affordable costs to keep everything running. We'll see how things evolve.- For now, I think the project is still in its infancy, I didn't want to create that level of limitation. But if I really see that this is necessary, I can create this kind of limitation.- This may prove to be the biggest challenge. It's always tricky to have highly automatic systems, but I will gradually create automatic filters. But most work will be done manually. But there will always have to be human moderation, initially me and maybe I can invite other users to be moderators.- If you want to have an account, you can request it.  For those who know, for example, the ImgBB service, I can say that it is very similar. Therefore, these are resources that can be implemented.
